stance_1: I am trying to eat less animal protein
stance_2: I want to eat healthier
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that trying to eat less animal protein is motivated by wanting to be healthier.

stance_1: I am trying to eat less animal protein
stance_2: I eat chicken, beef, and pork
justification: Eating chicken, beef, and pork conflicts with the goal of reducing animal protein, though the interviewee is in transition.

stance_1: I am trying to eat less animal protein
stance_2: I eat one can of chicken a day
justification: Eating one can of chicken daily is at odds with the stated goal of reducing animal protein, though this is acknowledged as a work in progress.

stance_1: I am trying to eat less animal protein
stance_2: I purchase ground beef twice a month
justification: Purchasing ground beef regularly is somewhat inconsistent with the goal to reduce animal protein, though the interviewee is transitioning.

stance_1: I am trying to eat less animal protein
stance_2: I purchase bacon once a month
justification: Purchasing bacon, even if infrequently, somewhat conflicts with the aim to eat less animal protein.

stance_1: I am trying to eat less animal protein
stance_2: I eat a lot of salmon
justification: Eating a lot of salmon is still a form of consuming animal protein, which is contrary to the goal, but may be seen as a lesser evil.

stance_1: I avoid lamb and veal
